Trial_Design.evidence: randomized to undergo CABG or CABG + SVR

Participants.evidence: Of 1,000 STICH patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), left ventricular (LV) ejection fraction (EF) ≤35% and anterior dysfunction

Intervention.evidence: randomized to undergo CABG or CABG + SVR

Objective.evidence: the aim of the study was to assess the impact of RV dysfunction on clinical outcome

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients were followed for a median of 48 months. All-cause mortality or cardiovascular hospitalization was the primary endpoint

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomized to undergo CABG or CABG + SVR

Number_Analysed.evidence: baseline RV function could be assessed by echocardiography in 866 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients with moderate or severe RV dysfunction who received CABG + SVR had significantly worse outcomes compared to patients who received CABG alone on both the primary (HR=1.86; CI=1.06–3.26; p=0.028) and the secondary endpoint (HR=3.37; CI=1.36–8.37; p=0.005)
